intro: Ageratina paupercula, commonly known as the poor man's ageratum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has delicate, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats across its native range.
